intro: Dontostemon scorpioides, commonly known as the scorpionweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
